landing.title: Genmypass
landing.subtitle: Zero-knowledge password manager. Your passwords, encrypted in your cloud.
landing.featureCloudStorageDesc: Data stored in your Google Drive
landing.footer: © 2024 Genmypass. Made with ❤️ for your security.

connect.title: Connect Your Storage
connect.subtitle: Your encrypted vault will be stored in your personal cloud.
connect.errorDrive: Could not connect to Google Drive. Please try again.
connect.whyStorage: Why do we need this storage connection?

whyStorageModal.title: Why connect your cloud?
whyStorageModal.paragraph1: Genmypass stores your encrypted vault in your Google Drive. We do not use our own servers to store your data.
whyStorageModal.paragraph2: By encrypting everything before uploading, only you can decrypt it with your master password. Neither we nor Google can see your passwords.
whyStorageModal.paragraph3: Plus, your vault syncs across devices: phone, computer, etc. Always accessible wherever you need it.

callback.setupAccount: Connection successful! Setting up your account...

password.title: Create Master Password
password.subtitle: Set a strong password to protect your digital life. This is the only key to your vault.
password.warningDesc: Write it down and keep it in a safe place. Genmypass is zero-knowledge; if you lose this password, your data is gone forever.

learnZeroKnowledgeModal.title: What is Zero-Knowledge?
learnZeroKnowledgeModal.paragraph1: Zero-knowledge means your data is encrypted on your device before being stored. Only you have the master password to decrypt it.
learnZeroKnowledgeModal.paragraph2: We never see your passwords or your vault contents. We cannot recover them if you forget them.
learnZeroKnowledgeModal.paragraph3: It's like a safe: you hold the lock and key. We only provide the space to put it.

password.footerNote: This password encrypts your vault locally on this device.
password.footerEncrypts: Your data never leaves your device unencrypted.
password.errorSetup: Error setting up your account. Please try again.

security.selectModel: Select the encryption model that best fits your security needs.
security.passwordOnlyDesc: Secure your vault with just your master password. Standard zero-knowledge encryption that's easy to access across all your devices.
security.dualKeyDesc: Requires both your Master Password and a unique Secret Key file stored locally. Protection even if your password is compromised.

whatsDifferenceModal.title: Difference between modes
whatsDifferenceModal.passwordOnlyDesc: You only need to remember your master password. Ideal if you prioritize simplicity and quick access from any device. Perfect for most users.
whatsDifferenceModal.dualKeyDesc: Requires your password plus a secret key file you must store. Greater protection against password theft or keyloggers, but more steps to unlock and set up on new devices.

security.zeroKnowledgeDesc: We can never see your data. Your encryption keys never leave your device.

secretKey.title: Save Your Secret Key
secretKey.subtitle: This key is required to decrypt your vault on new devices. We do not store a copy of it.
secretKey.criticalDesc: Without this file + your password, your vault CANNOT be recovered. There is no 'forgot password' option.
secretKey.savedCheckbox: I have saved my secret key in a safe place, such as a physical safe or an offline storage device.

whereToStoreModal.title: Where should I store it?
whereToStoreModal.recommended1: Physical safe or fireproof box at home
whereToStoreModal.recommended2: USB drive or external disk kept in a secure location
whereToStoreModal.recommended3: Backup in another password manager or secure (encrypted) note
whereToStoreModal.avoid1: Storing it in the cloud in plain text, in email, or in unencrypted notes

whatIfLoseModal.title: What if I lose it?
whatIfLoseModal.p1: Without this key and your master password, your vault cannot be recovered. We do not store a copy.
whatIfLoseModal.p2: There is no «forgot my password» or account recovery—by design, no one can access your data without the key and password.
whatIfLoseModal.p3: That is why it is essential to save it in a safe place before continuing.

lock.title: Genmypass
lock.enterPassword: Enter your master password to access your encrypted passwords.
lock.noToken: Google Drive session expired. Reconnect your account to unlock your vault.
lock.configNotFound: Vault configuration not found. Set up your account again.
lock.vaultNotFound: Vault not found. Set up your account again.
lock.vaultGone: Vault no longer exists. Set up your account again.
lock.wrongPasswordOrError: Wrong password or error loading vault.
lock.footer: Protected by end-to-end encryption. Your data never leaves your device unencrypted.

vault.emptySubtitle: Add your first password to start securing your digital life
vault.breachWarning_one: This password appeared in {{count}} data breach.
vault.breachWarning_other: This password appeared in {{count}} data breaches.

entry.deleteConfirm: Delete this password? This action cannot be undone.
entry.name: Name
entry.notesPlaceholder: Add extra details, backup codes, or security questions...
entry.footerEncrypt: This data will be encrypted with your master password before being stored.

settings.title: Settings
settings.autoLockDesc: Automatically lock the vault after inactivity
settings.disconnectConfirm: Are you sure you want to disconnect? You will need to connect again to access your vault.
settings.disconnectAndSwitchConfirm: You will be signed out from the current provider and taken to the connection screen. You can then choose another provider (Google Drive or Dropbox). If you already have a vault there you can unlock it; otherwise you can create a new one.
settings.scanBreaches: Scan your vault against known data breaches

changePassword.title: Change Master Password
changePassword.securityWarningDesc: Changing your master password will re-encrypt your entire vault. This may take a few minutes. Please do not close the browser during this process.
changePassword.dualKeyDesc: Your account is protected by dual-key encryption. Changing your master password updates your cloud encryption key, but your local device keys remain unchanged.
changePassword.reEncryptingDesc: Please do not refresh the page or close your browser tab.
changePassword.errorVaultNotFound: Vault not found. Open your vault and try again.
changePassword.errorSave: Error saving vault. Check your connection.

folders.title: Categories
folders.noCategories: You don't have any categories yet. Create them to organize your passwords.
folders.name: Name
folders.nameExists: A category with that name already exists.
folders.deleteWithPasswords_one: Delete this category? {{count}} password will be moved to "Uncategorized".
folders.deleteWithPasswords_other: Delete this category? {{count}} passwords will be moved to "Uncategorized".

exportPage.title: Export
exportPage.connectFirst: Connect your vault and unlock to export.
exportPage.encryptedDesc: Download a .genmypass file encrypted with your master password. Only you can open it.
exportPage.csvDesc: Export passwords as plain text CSV. Only for moving to another password manager. Delete the file after import.
exportPage.confirmEncrypted: Confirm your master password to create the encrypted backup.
exportPage.verifyCsv: Verify your identity to export the CSV file.
exportPage.deleteAfterImport: Delete this file after importing to your new password manager.

importPage.title: Import
importPage.dropHere: Drop a file here or click to choose
importPage.saveAfterImportError: Import completed on this device, but could not save to cloud. Check your connection.
importPage.saveAfterRestoreError: Could not save restored vault to cloud. Check your connection.
importPage.genmypassPasswordDesc: Enter the master password used to create this backup.

settings.categoriesDesc: Create and manage categories to organize passwords
settings.dataPortabilityDesc: Export or import your vault items
settings.deleteVaultDesc: Delete all local and cloud data. This action cannot be undone.
settings.deleteError: Could not delete from Google Drive. Delete local data only?

audit.checkBreachedDesc: Scan your vault against known data breaches using Have I Been Pwned. Passwords are checked with k-anonymity; only a hash prefix is sent.
audit.noPasswordsToScan: No passwords to scan. Add entries to your vault first.
